benchmark_details.name: SynthScars
benchmark_details.overview: SynthScars is a high-quality and diverse dataset consisting of 12,236 fully synthetic images with human-expert annotations. It features 4 distinct image content types, 3 categories of artifacts, and fine-grained annotations covering pixel-level segmentation, detailed textual explanations, and artifact category labels.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive dataset for synthetic image detection that supports fine-grained artifact analysis.

data.source: Aggregated synthetic image samples from multiple datasets including RichHF-18K, Chameleon, and FFAA.
data.annotation: Human-expert annotations with irregular polygon masks, detailed artifact explanations.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on the segmentation performance of artifact localization tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Higher mIoU and F1 score indicates better artifact localization accuracy in synthetic images.
methodology.baseline_results: LEGION outperforms the strongest expert model, PAL4VST, by 10.65 points in F1 score for Object category on SynthScars.
methodology.validation: Extensive experiments conducted across multiple benchmarks.
